name: Aloft Brussels Schuman Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed back in sep and have to say the hotel has got even better - best shower I have ever had and liked the self checkout machines very cool
reviews.title: Love it

reviews.text: Stylish, well-located, with friendly staff and great newly renovated rooms Aloft Schuman brings a new experience of visiting Brussels. Everything is minimalistic, convenient and well thought-through. The rooms are studio-like with flat screen tv's and in-room internet. The big bathroom shower heads are perfect to relax after a long day of strolling the city. The only inconvenience is somewhat soft mattresses for those who like sleeping on hard beds. Upon check out your luggage can be left in a baggage room by a very helpful receptionist. Downtown can be reached by a direct metro line. Leopoldspark is a few steps away - the colors of autumn are striking there. I was promised a one-of-a-kind experience in my reservation confirmation and I certainly got it there! Thumbs up!
reviews.title: A great way to discover the trendy and friendly side of Brussels by choosing Aloft Schuman for your weekend break

reviews.text: First stay in an aloft and frankly speaking it was good!
reviews.title: Interesting new concept

reviews.text: Only one thing that bothered me - the curtains in the room. The lack of diffuser curtains meant it was either wide-open for the world to see or pitch black in the room.
reviews.title: Wow! What a surprise--in a good way!

reviews.text: Love the self-serve laundry, great for long trips!
reviews.title: Great Concept, Let Down by Poor Staff

reviews.text: This was the first hotel that I booked on my own for my recent travels around europe (previous ones were made by my friends), and they did not disappoint. It took some time for us to check in as all the twin bed rooms were taken, and while we waited for our room, the receptionists gave us a voucher to use for the bar. We were able to use it later on in the evening when we returned from our trip, which was nice. After a 5-10 minute wait we were able to get to our room.
reviews.title: Really good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place itself is modern and quite trendy. There is a bar, some pool tables and a room for the kids that has a nintendo wii. There is also a snack bar but we never ate there as there are just more choices when you get to the town centre which is just a 5 minute train ride from there. The location is good as well, it is near the EU quarters and the Cinquentanaire park. There nearest train stop would be schumann and it's just 5-10 minutes to get to the grand place.
reviews.title: An easy breezy hotel with a few minor niggles

reviews.text: The rooms were quite good, and they give out a 5 euro voucher for the snack bar if you decide that you won't need new towels for the next day of your stay. The beds are comfortable, pillow a bit too soft. The place is non smoking so you would need to go to the terrace if you want to go for one. The terrace is quite comfortable as well.
reviews.title: Perfect for the modern Traveller !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my partner booked a 3 night stay at the Aloft Brussels. We both found the hotel modern and trendy. The hotel is close to the Schuman metro station and has two convenience stores located near the hotel, one been next door but one form the hotel. There is also a park across the square to the left form the hotel which is nice and had little turtles swimming in the lake.
reviews.title: Hip, comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a good size and the lady at check in offered us the choice of two which we chose one on the eighth floor. We are glad we did as it had a good high view and lifted us up from some of the traffic noise from the main road below. The free Wi-Fi was fantastic in the room and the bed was amazing! If they ever decided to set up a business selling beds I would be their first customer! Also in the room was a small fridge and large TV.
reviews.title: Nothing to shout about

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we go back to Brussels, we will go back to ALoft. Perfect hotel for young people, managed by nice young people. Helpful staff, big and modern rooms with everything you can possibly need (iron, huge tv with connections to all devices, kettle and tea/coffee). Near the European Parliament, and 20 minutes walk to the city center or just a few metro stops.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very close to Schuman metro station, but also by walking you can reach the center in 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Modern hotel

reviews.text: It's very modern, you do self check-in, have free internet connection, environment is cool and very coloured.
reviews.title: Good for price

reviews.text: Also breakfast is very good (even if a bit expensive)
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, very good price!

reviews.text: Traveled with an extended family including 3 kids and booked two rooms here primarily because the price was great, the place is modern and the TA reviews were good.
reviews.title: 21st Century Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: definitely recommend staying here. The staff was very friendly and helpful! There is a metro stop right around the corner and a supermarket right up the street. Just a short 5 minute walk and you can find some delicious Belgian/French restaurants (and a great Belgian fry stand!).
reviews.title: great hotel, very modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here last weekend and had a wonderful stay. The hotel is well situated within walking distance of several parks, the bakery Paul (with super yummy croissants) and the Schumann metro station (with quick access to the tourist attractions in Brussels). Our hotel room was very stylish and modern - we had a super comfortable mattress, a nice sized television, and Bliss shampoo/body lotions. The guest lobby was also really stylish and inviting - it had a pool table, board games and newspapers/local guides to read. The management and staff here are exceptional and went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable one. This hotel is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Brussels. Just make sure to request a room on one of the higher floors if you are a light sleeper.
reviews.title: Love this hotel!

reviews.text: This was my third sojourn in Aloft Hotel ( after September and Oct 2010) and I found this place as modern, stylish and design than when it opened in Sept 2010. Prices though are higher and clients are more business type. Staff is young, dynamic, very friendly. Breakfast area might surprise because it is a bit like a cafeteria where you have to serve yourself. Rooms are large (42m2), modern, with fancy colours on top of grey shades. The best views are over the place, otherwise you end up facing a building with various windows, so with limited privacy when curtains are open. Mattresses are large, super comfortable. Showers are spacious too, but might lack of privacy if you share a twin room, because of the clear glass door.
reviews.title: A design and modern hotel next to EU HQs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a nutshell, I love this hotel, it is one of my favorite in Brussels because of its comfort and modernity. So many hotels are old style. Only internet wifi is not up to standard. It is very low, irreliable... a pity for most of customers.
reviews.title: great staff

reviews.text: my stay there was awesome and very friendly! would stay again! the staff where very helpful in pointing out on a map that they have at the reception the must see sights! the breakfast area was nice! The internet service was perfect!Well located!
reviews.title: What a Hotel should be!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights for the wedding in Brussels. We were in the room 304 with a not bad view (grass).
reviews.title: Great neighborhood, nice facilities, good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was equipped with comfortable king size bed with brand new modern decoration in the room. relax environment, save and quiet area with 5 walk to metro station. 1 mins walk to Leopard park and 3 mins walk to a lot of great bistro and restaurant- even supermarket.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: But the lobby offered self-helped food area with reasonable price.
reviews.title: great stay in a cool hotel

reviews.text: It would be great for the travelers who want to have quiet neighborhood instead of crowds.
reviews.title: Outstanding service, comfort, cleanliness & kid-friendly too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first thing i didnt like - we arrived on 7 June and it was about 24C outside and there's no air-conditioning in the lobby and hall way. same the next morning/afternoon.- but in the room, the air-conditioner worked well.
reviews.title: Affordable Stay with a Fun Vibe

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and modern. The staff were very friendly and helpful and provided us with a 'better than guide book' map. The lobby is a chill out area with pool table and games. This was great for us, but older visitors may find it a bit too modern. I thought it was great. The room was spacious with a wet room style shower. I know it shouldn't be a deal breaker but tv included BBC1 and 2! The location was good if you were in town on EU business - only a short walk from the parliament building. It was a 45 min walk in to the centre - a nice walk. Or alternatively the Schumann metro stop is 3 mins walk away. Be careful that you get the right place - google maps has it wrong at the moment. Use the address not hotel name. There is a Paul cafe just round the corner that is great for breakfast.
reviews.title: Great concept hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my second Aloft stay and the first in Brussels (first was in Abu Dhabi).
reviews.title: If you are not a complicated traveler, you'll surely like it

reviews.text: The nice thing about this hotel is the concept they are bringing in. As a quick traveller, what do you need, a Wonderful bed (which they have), a TV to watch some news and movies (they have a large 42" LCD), Internet (Free and complimentary). Both Hotels Abu Dhabi and Brussels look the same and they both opened in 2010.
reviews.title: Too modern for old business test

reviews.text: Some people argue about the food concept, well... as day or 2 days traveler, what do you want from the hotel, a quick bite in the morning with coffee, and for dinner, i normally eat in Grande Place, take the metro, walk down 5 minutes and here you are in your room.
reviews.title: DIsappointed

reviews.text: The hotel has a very nice shower, water pressure was ideal.
reviews.title: Not my sort of place

reviews.text: I spent one night here and was very impressed. Not only was this the best value for my company but the price included breakfast, free wifi etc. I think there is a gym as well but..the bar called!
reviews.title: Probably my new favourite Brussels Hotel

reviews.text: The place is modern and bright and it is a bit like staying in Ikea for the night, which is not altogether a bad thing. My bed was large and comfortable, the WiFi fast, the TV huge with connections for multimedia devices (might bring my Xbox next time). The rooms were large and well decorated and the hotel was quiet, although I did hear the occasional siren. (Can't be helped). Extraordinarily for Brussels, the Air Con worked and maintained a comfortable temperature throughout my stay...well done Aloft.
reviews.title: Aloft Brussels, great place to stay

reviews.text: The reception area is equally quirky with free wifi and some fixed iMacs to access the internet too. The bar looks good and a glass of Leffe was 4 Euros (not hotel rip off prices). Apparently they have a happy hour in the bar but I was not swift enough for that. Breakfast is help yourself fare, with 5 items included if you get the correct room rate. No hot food though for hungry Brits but ample for those of a continental bias. I had Orange Juice (good quality), a boiled egg, a yoghurt, a pain au chocolate and a bowl of Frosties. More than enough.
reviews.title: Amazing Wifi in a modern, apartment style hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a pleasant stay and although it is in the Schuman district it is within only a short Metro hop to the Grand Place so do not be put off with location. Oh and the staff were pleasant too, they obviously like working in this hotel as it shows with their attitude towards the customers.
reviews.title: Modern, trendy and hip

reviews.text: I will be back..see you in June!
reviews.title: Relaxed atmosphere and friendly service
Easy breezy? Not likely...
reviews.text: In all fairness, as I did not actually stay at this hotel, I am in no position to make comments on rooms, value, sleep quality, etc.

However, I do have a complaint concerning customer service. I booked this hotel through booking.com and it could be cancelled free of charge. As it was the case, I made use of this option and received an e-mail from booking.com confirming my cancellation, also confirming this was free of charge. Today, I checked my credit card statement online and guess what? They charged my credit card anyway!
reviews.title: Modernes Businesshotel

reviews.text: Now I have to go through booking.com sending them my credit card statement, confirmation of cancellation and having them contact the hotel for me, not knowing how long it will take before they reimburse me. Easy breezy? I don't think so!
reviews.title: My new home in Brussels

reviews.text: I regularly have to stay in Brussels, but I do not think I will again consider staying there.
reviews.title: Cool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a Weekendtrip in BXL (La Demence) and tried the Hotel 2 days after it opened. Rooms are great and comfortable. Staff was a bit over motivated but that would be normal in a new place.
reviews.title: trendy spot - will go again

reviews.text: First, let me preface this by saying I have never had a bad experience with a Starwood hotel. I travel in Europe for business about 3 weeks of every month and through this, often visit the Brussels area. Prior to my stay at the Aloft, I was already very happy with my usual accomodations at the Four Points by Sheraton and was admittedly a little hesitant to try anything else because the staff there have always been so good to me. But, my colleagues had informed me that the new Aloft was opening and I thought I'd give it a try.
reviews.title: New Favorite Hotel in Brussels

reviews.text: I was the 2nd person to ever check in at the hotel and stayed for about 2 weeks - giving me a full view of all aspects of the business - and can now state with full confidence that this is my new favorite location in Brussels.
reviews.title: acceptable hotel in EU area

reviews.text: From day one, the team there had everything up and running - I never had an issue with the Internet, receiving packages or messages at the front desk, printing documents, ordering a taxi or getting directions - I don't think I can say that for any other hotel I've ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Modern, clean, good amenities

reviews.text: The gym is well stocked with towels, etc and has everything you need to get a good workout. The re:Fuel kitchenette area has a good variety of snacks and meals to choose from if you're in a rush. The rooms are huge by European standards and fully equipped with a desk, couch, and plenty of closet space. The parking garage is small - only about 10 spots - but I never had trouble finding a space. The bar is very cool and reminds me of many of the happy hour locations I frequently visit with colleagues in Washington, DC - were I a local, I could see myself popping in for a post-work drink on a regular basis.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel,courteous and helpful staff;convenient location

reviews.text: By far, the best aspect of my stay was the staff - every employee was exceptionally helpful and always quick to ask if I need anything and to say good morning - or in Aloft fashion - aloha. A few even took the time to remember my name and room number within the first few days of my stay - certainly not necessary, but appreciated.
reviews.title: very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel, different then the other hotels in the Starwood collection. Lounge music in the bar, happy hour with each day a different cocktail :-)
reviews.title: Super trendy hotel!

reviews.text: Nice and clean rooms, very friendly staff.
reviews.title: Stayed here - 'cause it's worth it

reviews.text: Ideal for a weekend Brussels and in the weekend best rates.
reviews.title: Ideal if you are young, hip and single

reviews.text: Location of the hotel is easy, in the weekend you can park your car in the neighbourhood for free.
reviews.title: Great hotel to stay in Brussels, especially on weekends

reviews.text: Just stayed at the Aloft Brussels Schuman hotel for the second time and was by no way disappointed! Thought that the pleasant experience I had when I stayed there for the first time a few months ago could be a "one of experience" but no - same nice experience as the first time. Arrived quite early in the day and my room was not ready. Recepcionist said she would do anything to get me my room as soon as possible. Only waited for about 15 minutes in the lounge area whilst making use of the free wi-fi before the receptionist came and told me my room was ready. Excellent spacious room with everyting one could expect from a modern hotel (right down to toiletries of a hip brand!); true in-room high-speed free wi-fi. Large choice in the breakfast buffet. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Bar and Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: excellent hotel with great customer service. emailed about early check in or luggage storage prior to visit and prompt email back confirmed they would try and help- and they did. there was a room ready 2 hours before agreed check in time. room was spacious, clean and modern. walk in shower was lovely, as was free toiletries and complimentary water. hotel have a scheme by where if you opt out of linen and towel changes you get 5 euros to spend in the bar, on breakfast or donate to charity. there is a happy hour in the bar, and there is pool table, wii games and a nice terrace to enjoy. i would without a doubt stay here again as it was a beautiful modern hotel, excellent value for money and very close to Schuman metro station. TIP: there is a lovely park across the road from the rear entrance of the hotel!
reviews.title: amazing, made the trip!!!
Clean, friendly and modern hotel
reviews.text: I stayed at the Aloft Brussels for a solo business trip. The nearest metro station is Schuman; follow the exit signs for Schuman Place (Justus Lipsus). As the other reviews have mentioned, this is a contemporary hotel which may not suit all tastes. I was impressed by the welcome from the reception staff, who all speak perfect English. I stayed in a king room and had a great sleep. The hotel has free WIFI and BBC channels available on the TV. My room was spacious but a few necessities weren't immediately obvious; an iron and ironing board is located in a shelf at the side of the bed and there is a sliding door for the bathroom (the room is open plan). There is an excellent power shower in the room and the usual free toiletries. My only complaint would be the lack of mirror in the bedroom, however there is a mirror above the sink and a full length mirror on the back of the bathroom sliding door. A continental buffet breakfast is available but the inclusive option is limited to five items (including a drink). The area seems safe and there are lots of restaurants on Rue Franklin, which is a short walk from the hotel. I will definitely stay here on future business trips to Brussels and I'm disappointed Aloft don't have lots of other hotels in Europe!

This is the first hotel I have stayed at where we had to make up our own bed, literally. We arrived at the check-in and the man said to my son, would you like a bed to sleep in? He then gave my son an air-mattress and a pump. We booked months in advance and they knew there were three of us. We should have a proper bed for my son. This is disgusting.They did not even offer to set up the air-mattress and sheets!!!!!
reviews.title: Very dissapointing

reviews.text: We were then told to take all our bags out of our car as it was likely the windows would be smashed and our bags stolen. It was hard to find a car park and we had to park far from the hotel. It was unnecessary hardship for us to drag our suitcases through the streets.
reviews.title: Modern, functional and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and son wanted to eat. It was late, we tried outside. Nothing close suited her. She came back to the hotel and was shocked to find a plastic wrapped heat your own meal for $12 Euros. She heated it in the microwave. She sat down at a table and was promptly told to leave as it was a wedding night and no tables open. She sat on the floor. I was upstairs and they only gave one key. The key is needed to operate the elevator. My wife sat downstairs, highly embarrassed after sitting on the floor eating dinner, then had to wait for me to come down.
reviews.title: Worth the money

reviews.text: First up, the hotel is located very close (400m) to Schuman Metro station. From there you can get any where in Brussels - including Brussels Midi Train Station.
reviews.title: Superb hotel, great value & friendly staff

reviews.text: When I booked I was looking for a triple room. I found that the Aloft was so reasonably priced that I could book two separate rooms for what other hotels were charging for triples. My parents had a room on the 1st floor and I had a room on the 8th floor. The rooms were identical – except mirrored.
reviews.title: Excellent design, service and huge rooms for a very good price

reviews.text: The room on the 8th floor felt larger for some reason, but I put this down to the fact the 1st floor room had its window obscured by a raised path and trees. The 8th floor room was MUCH brighter and had a lovely breeze flow through when the window was opened. If you asked me I would take the 8th floor room any day. All rooms come with controllable air-conditioning which was a relief. It was very warm while we were there and having the ability to cool the room was great.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.text: The Wi-Fi was sensational – lightening fast and with a constant signal. The tea and coffee facilities were welcomed, as was the generous size safe (I could fit my laptop in there). The dispensers in the shower mean you never run out of body wash or shampoo and the shower is great after a long day of sightseeing in Brussels. The TV has loads of stations with loads of languages on offer, and there is also a gym (which I used) which is very clean and fresh, and has controllable air conditioners in it.
reviews.title: Very nice but not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are super friendly, the decor is very funky and modern. We spent an late evening in the hotel bar when we got in after sightseeing. The prices were very reasonable and there is a good cocktail menu. There is also a ‘play room’, which made a game of Wii Tennis very interesting after a few drinks.
reviews.title: Funky

description: The new tWist in Travel keeps Brussels European district Abuzz with a prime location in the heart of the European quarter. Located only a few minutes away from the city center by metro, the Aloft Brussels Schuman offers you an easy access and connections to the entire Brussels area. The hotel offers an eclectic mix of forward-thinking design, open loft-inspired rooms and free WiFi. The always Abuzz WXYZ Bar welcomes you daily with a selection of signatures cocktails, that you can sip on our backyard when the wheather permits. Aloft Brussels Schuman is the fun, fresh alternative to stay and play at an affordable price.
